page.title: 03Banstead Wood - Layout
page.content: This 80 hectare triangle of deciduous woodland is the largest in this block. It covers the NE corner of the ridge between Park Down and Chipstead Bottom. Two sets of buildings impinge upon it. The Park Farm group in the N has an old P.O.W. camp as its nucleus and nowadays accommmodates council workers plus depot, and a Scout Centre. To the W the wood surrounds the Queen Elizabeth Hospital. A car park and footpaths make the wood very accessible, yet it is relatively unspoilt.This is because it is fenced and swing-gated and the bylaws prohibiting damage or removal of any living or dead material are strictly applied. The varied woody and herbaceous flora is described on other pages.
